pizzaProgram.gui.EventHandlers
Class OrderGUI_TemporaryOrderDataStorage

java.lang.Object
  pizzaProgram.gui.EventHandlers.OrderGUI_TemporaryOrderDataStorage

public class OrderGUI_TemporaryOrderDataStorage
extends Object

A class that temporarily holds order data while the user is creating a new order in the Order GUI

Author:
IT1901 Group 3, Fall 2011

OrderGUI_TemporaryOrderDataStorage

public OrderGUI_TemporaryOrderDataStorage()
Method Detail

convertToOrderObjectAndReset

public UnaddedOrder convertToOrderObjectAndReset()
This function generates an UnaddedOrder instance from the provided data, so that it can be sent to the database. It will then reset the temporary order storage, so that it can be used again for the next order.

Returns:
An UnaddedOrder instance containing all the order information stored in this object.

reset

public void reset()
Resets the data storage

setDeliveryMethod

public void setDeliveryMethod(String method)
Sets the order's delivery method

Parameters:
method - A value that matches one of the enum values of the deliveryMethod column in the database

setCustomer

public void setCustomer(Customer customer)
Sets the customer that is ordering the order

Parameters:
customer - A Customer instance, referring to a row in the Customers table in the database

setOrderComments

public void setOrderComments(String comments)
Sets any comments about the order.

Parameters:
comments - A String containing order comments

addDish

public void addDish(Dish dish,
                    Extra[] extrasToBeAddedToDish)
Adds a dish to the order that is currently being created

Parameters:
dish - The dish to be added
extrasToBeAddedToDish - The extras that are to be added, and are related to this dish

public int getNumberOfDishes()

The number of dishes that have currently been added to the order

public void duplicateDishInOrder(int indexInTable)
Duplicates a dish in the order, specified by the index of the row where the dish is shown in the table in the order GUI

Parameters:
